results.title: Under the weather
results.brief_description: In this whirlwind of stop motion animation, everday domestic objects are whipped into movement by a runaway weather report. A mixture of object animation and live action.

results.title: Serving suggestion
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Kate Riedl and Tony Thorne
results.brief_description: A snot nosed kid called Kevin eats his way through the snack aisle in the supermarket. When Kevin decides to go for the ‘Chocky Pops’, he doesn’t realise that he’ll end up with more than a mouthful. The supermarket becomes a jungle in this impressive computer animated short.

results.title: Pleasure domes
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Maggie Fooke
results.brief_description: Is Cannes really like St. Kilda, or is it just a state of mind? Animated watercolour drawings and hand coloured photocopies shape this introspective reflection on the nature of landscape and human responses to it. It hints that our perception of landscape is never direct but always filtered through a set of constructs, either physical or psychological.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Maggie Fooke

results.title: Plastic
results.brief_description: Evan’s world is a dark one. It is only his imagination that affords him some escape. The outside world’s harshness leads him finally to subversion and his escape is complete. An excellent discussion starter for exploring the issues of difference, and society’s perceptions of disability.

results.title: Lovely day
results.brief_description: Lovely Day is a masterpiece of painterly animation art. Painstakingly rendered in the style of Hieronymus Bosch, the central character and accompanying putto-like figures evoke memories of a time when the pianola was the price of the parlour and partying involved an old fashioned knees up sing along.

results.title: Plain sailing
results.creator_credit: Martin Cohen, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Designed to assist the small businessman by emphasising the necessity of a thorough knowledge and planning before embarking on a business venture. Describes some of the do’s and don’ts that can make or break a business.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin Cohen, Robin Hughes and Film Australia

results.title: Pleure Pas la Bouche Pleine = Don't Cry with Your Mouth Full
results.brief_description:
Annie and Frederic, aged 16 and 19 respectively, are courting during summer in Poitou. Secretly, Annie yearns for some more excitement and when Alexandre, superficially more sophisticated than the local boys, comes to Poitou, she gets it. Fragile and charming, this is a female rites of passage film, played in the context of happy family relationships and everyday people. Thomas brings to the whole enterprise an observant eye for the details of village life.

Credits: Director, Pascal Thomas ; writers, Pascal Thomas, Roland Duval, Suzanne Schiffman ; photography, Colin Mounier ; music, Vladimir Cosma.
Cast: Annie Cole, Frederic Duru, Jean Carmet, Christiane Chamaret, Bernard Menez, Daniel Ceccaldi.

results.title: Pleasure faire
results.creator_credit: Kris Paterson, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: From British Columbia, a day at a youth festival reminiscent of the folk fairs of medieval times, organised by people who choose to live outside the usual social pattern. The Pleasure Faire offered crowds a wide variety of hand-made objects—jewellery, beadwork, leatherwork, art, pottery. More than that, it provided a day of music, minstrel songs, dancing, and people participating in the spirit of the occasion, free of any commercialism or constraint. A day of joy, relived through the film.
